roleset.name: give back

example.name: no benefactive
example.text: Stock prices surged as [a multibillion-dollar takeover proposal]-1 helped *trace*-1 restore market players' confidence about the prospects for further deal-making.
example.arg: market players' confidence about the prospects for further deal-making.

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: Pacific Gas& Electric fell 3/8 to 19 5/8 in Big Board composite trading of 1.7 million shares and Pacific Telesis Group slipped 5/8 to 44 5/8 as [the companies]-1 worked *trace*-1 to restore service to areas affected by the quake.
example.arg: to areas affected by the quake.

example.name: Arg1
example.text: Call the municipal utility district office for restoration of service.

example.name: All arguments, within LVC
example.text: Also , he and Mr. Stein were ordered to make restitution of $ 35,000 to a customer .

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: ...as part of their joint restitution of nearly $5.4 million to private businesses.

roleset.note: RESTORE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'restore' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry contribute-13.2, other framed members include refer, relinquish, sacrifice, surrender, transfer. Comparison with those for one roleset. (from restore.01-v predicate notes)
RESTITUTION-N NOTES: Based on verb entry restore.01; corresponds to VN class contribute-13.2. (from restitution.01-n)

roleset.name: make like new, restore to previous state

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: `` A little patience and we shall see the reign of witches pass over , their spells dissolve , and the people recovering their true sight , restore their government to its true principles .
example.arg: the people recovering their true sight

example.name: Arg1
example.text: Building restoration describes a particular treatment approach and philosophy within the field of architectural conservation.

example.name: art
example.text: They also approved enforcement action to be taken to "secure the reversal of the works and the restitution of the building to its condition before the works took place."
example.arg: to its condition before the works took place."

roleset.note: RESTORE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'restore' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry contribute-13.2, other framed members include refer, relinquish, sacrifice, surrender, transfer. Comparison with those for one roleset. (from restore.02-v predicate notes)
RESTITUTION-N NOTES: Based on verb entry restore.02. No corresponding VN class. (from restitution.02-n)
Never seen this noun usage myself, but dictionary says it's possible. (from restitution.02-n)
